author: The Telegraph
title: Prize draw terms and conditions – APT
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands and Isle of Man aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and APT Group (“APT”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/apt and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced, corrupt or automated entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to APT Grand Bordeaux River Cruise Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by 23:59 on Thursday, December 31, 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. The winner must confirm their acceptance of the prize by making their booking with APT with 14 days of being notified. 7. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 8. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 9. One winning entrant will win an eight-day APT ‘Grand Bordeaux’ Royal Collection river cruise for two adults, departing on July 8, 2016. The prize package comprises: • Return economy class flights from London Heathrow, Birmingham, Manchester or Glasgow airports (subject to flight and booking class availability), including all airline imposed taxes and charges; • 7 nights cruising on a Aria river ship; • Twin-share accommodation in a Category D (Twin Window) cabin; • All sightseeing and meals, as specified on the itinerary; • Complimentary beverages on board (excludes French Champagne and premium spirits/wines); • All tipping for land and cruise staff; • Return home-to-airport transfers by private car (within a 75 driven mile radius of departure airport); • Scheduled arrival and departure transfers between the airport and ship; and • Port charges. The full cruise itinerary can be viewed here » 10. The winner’s guest must be over 18 years of age. The prize must be taken as one package. A cabin upgrade may be purchased at the winner’s expense. 11. The prize does not include travel between the winner’s home and airport outside the 75 mile radius as described in Condition 9, above; travel insurance; food and drink not included in the cruise itinerary; personal expenditure; or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. It is the responsibility of the prizewinner to ensure they and their guest each has a valid passport and travel insurance and obtain any necessary vaccinations and visas, at their own expense for their trip. 12. The winner and their guest must be available to travel on July 8, 2016 and travel together at all times. APT’s standard terms and conditions apply as set out in the 2016 Luxury River Cruising brochure, which can be found here (link to to below) [http://www.aptouring.co.uk/trips/europe/eubc08f?utm_source=Telegraphsupp&utm_medium=competition&utm_campaign=2016LRCv2] 13. All elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 14. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and APT. 15. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of APT. 17. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
